content.rendered:
Whether you’re someone to take photos by the pool or not, you are going to be asking, ‘is the iPhone SE waterproof or not? And we’ve got great news. As this is a lower tier handset, we didn’t expect to see an IP rating so it’s interesting that Apple have invested in this. Everyone is also shocked at just how just this small handset can resistant.

 

Get to know the IP rating

When a phone is released, a company may choose to invest in having the phone tested and certified with an IP rating. This shows the resistance levels against small particles and liquids. When you take a look at the iPhone SE, you’ll find out it actually has an IP67 rating, which is one of the higher levels of protection available these days. But, what does this all really mean?

The I represents protection against small particles, such as dust. The level of protection against these particles is then represented by the first number, in this case that would be 6. This means that the phone is completely resistant against damage from small particles. You’ll see that this is pretty standard amongst all major handsets now. The P shows that the phone has some sort of protection against liquid. The level of protection is represented by the last number, with the iPhone SE being 7. Following certifications, this shows that the phone is protected against the effects of water between 15cm and 1 metre for up to 30 minutes.

 

The Limitations

Of course, with anything, there’s limitations that you’ll want to be aware of. So, from the above, you can see that the answer to, ‘is the iPhone SE waterproof’ is pretty obvious. Whilst your phone is not going to completely combust if you don’t stick to the limitations, it’s likely to get some level of water damage, which is not covered by warranty.

You will only be able to use the iPhone SE in up to 1 metre of liquid for up to 30 minutes. As long as you’re not swimming along the bottom of a pool or swimming in the sea with the smartphone, you should be absolutely fine. If you spill a drink over your phone, leave it in the bathroom whilst showering or even just want to snap a few pictures next to the pool, you’ll be absolutely fine to do so. You won’t be able to keep the iPhone SE in water for longer if it’s not at the 1 metre limit as water will begin to leak into the phone after this point. You also won’t be able to take the phone deeper than this limit for any length of time.

 

Is the iPhone SE waterproof?

In short, the iPhone SE is not waterproof but it is water resistant. An important thing to take into consideration when trying to find out whether or not a phone is waterproof is that waterproof and water resistant are not the same. Currently, you won’t find a smartphone that is completely waterproof as we just don’t have that technology. As more and more phones are released, we’re seeing the damage caused by liquids drop significantly. Overall, you’ll be safe taking the iPhone SE in small amounts of water within the suggested time frame.

 

Hopefully, this can all answer your question of ‘is the iPhone SE waterproof? If you’re in search of some of the best iPhone SE deals around, we’re sure we’ll be able to help you out.
